frontmatter.title: Avoiding the comfort trap
frontmatter.description: Everyone should get in the habit of interviewing themselves for their own jobs. Here's my advice on why, and it's probably not what you think.

frontmatter.title: Why you should answer every single recruiter InMail
frontmatter.description: Most people think of recruiter InMails as spam, but not me. I see opportunity in every one.

frontmatter.title: Developer Relations in 2022 - Where I'm focusing
frontmatter.description: What does 2022 hold for Slack Developer Advocacy, and the industry in general? There's two big things I know my team will focus on.

frontmatter.title: The best Incident Commanders might not be where you think
frontmatter.description: The Incident Commander is a powerful role in the world of Incident Management that is traditionally filled by senior engineers and engineering managers. But have you ever considered that maybe you should be casting your net a bit wider when it comes to staffing that role?

frontmatter.title: Improving your video conference setup
frontmatter.description: It's been over a year now, and hybrid/remote events are here to stay. Here's some suggestions on what tools you can invest in to level up your video conference setup so every event you do hits that professionalism bar you want.
